LinuxConf Europe 2007

01 Sep 2007 It's 5.45am and I'm about ready to depart to Cambridge UK where LinuxConf.eu 2007 starts tomorrow morning. If everything goes as planned, we should arrive in Cambridge around mid-day today. My bus is set to depart at about 7am to the trainstation. From there, I take the train to Brussels-south where the EuroStar train takes us to London Waterloo (departure 8.59, half hour checkin time). Then a metro to London King's Cross and from there a train to Cambridge.

Let's hope all of this makes sense when we're underway...

On a sidenote, I'm curious to see whether or not Belgium will still be here when I get back on september 5th, or whether it will have been ripped in 2 by our politicians... :)
